member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsResources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsResources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsResources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsResources.BingMapsLogo
member.summary: Looks up a localized resource of type System.Drawing.Bitmap.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsTileSystem.Clip(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Clips a number to the specified minimum and maximum values.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsTileSystem.MapSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines the map width and height (in pixels) at a specified level of detail.
member.param: Level of detail, from 1 (lowest detail) to 23 (highest detail).
member.returns: The map width and height in pixels.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsTileSystem.PixelXYToLatLong(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Converts a pixel from pixel XY coordinates at a specified level of detail into latitude/longitude WGS-84 coordinates (in degrees).
member.param: X coordinate of the point, in pixels.
Y coordinates of the point, in pixels.
Level of detail, from 1 (lowest detail) to 23 (highest detail).
Output parameter receiving the latitude in degrees.
Output parameter receiving the longitude in degrees.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsZoomLevelSet
member.summary: This class represents the zoom levels used by Bing Maps.
member.remarks: If you want to create some layers that match up with Bing Maps layers, you should use this ZoomSet.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Layers.BingMapsZoomLevelSet.#ctor
member.summary: This class represents the zoom levels used by Bing Maps.
member.remarks: If you want to create some layers that match up with Bing Maps layers, you should use this ZoomSet.
